meanings.definition: To write or transliterate into the Latin alphabet.
meanings.sent1: She romanizes the ancient text for easier understanding.
meanings.sent2: The software romanizes the foreign names for the database.
meanings.sent3: The teacher romanizes the students' names on the attendance sheet.
meanings.sent4: His love for Latin romanizes his approach to learning new languages.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush romanizes the characters into a modern setting.

meanings.definition: To make Roman in character or style.
meanings.sent1: The architect romanizes the building with columns and arches.
meanings.sent2: The chef romanizes the dish by using traditional Roman spices.
meanings.sent3: The comedian romanizes his jokes with references to ancient Rome.
meanings.sent4: Her fashion sense romanizes the classic Roman togas into trendy outfits.
meanings.sent5: The music producer romanizes the song with Roman-inspired melodies.
